nodes.bodyText: This is taken from the documentation, but I think it is a little unspecific. Could we put something more descriptive here and also for the next property?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,17 @@
+<@lib.dto desc = "Describes a rule of a password policy.">
+
+    <@lib.property
+        name = "placeholder"
+        type = "string"
+        desc = "A placeholder string that can be used to display an internationalized message to the user."

nodes.bodyText: I think this might be overly specific. It is also brittle if the properties change at some point. It is also a bit redundant, because, the dto has its own description which the user can read.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,18 @@
+<@lib.dto>
+
+    <@lib.property
+        name = "password"
+        type = "string"
+        desc = "The candidate password to be check against the password policy."
+    />
+
+    <@lib.property
+        name = "profile"
+        type = "ref"
+        dto = "UserProfileDto"
+        last = true
+        desc = "A JSON object containing variable key-value pairs. The object contains the following properties:

nodes.bodyText:
This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    name = "name"
          
          
            
                    name = "groupUsers"
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,18 @@
+<@lib.dto>
+
+    <@lib.property
+        name = "groups"
+        type = "array"
+        dto = "IdentityServiceGroupDto"
+        desc = "An array of group objects."
+    />
+
+    <@lib.property
+        name = "name"

nodes.bodyText: The response dto based on the Rest API is PasswordPolicyDto that contains a List ofPasswordPolicyRuleDto
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,73 @@
+<#-- Generated From File: camunda-docs-manual/public/reference/rest/identity/get-password-policy/index.html -->
+{
+  <@lib.endpointInfo
+      id = "getPasswordPolicy"
+      tag = "Identity"
+      summary = "Get Password Policy"
+      desc = "A password policy consists of a list of rules that new passwords must follow to be
+              policy compliant. This end point returns a JSON representation of the
+              list of policy rules. More information on password policies in Camunda can be found in the password policy
+              [user guide](${docsUrl}/user-guide/process-engine/password-policy/) and in
+              the [security instructions](${docsUrl}/user-guide/security/)."
+  />
+
+  "responses": {
+
+    <@lib.response
+        code = "200"
+        dto = "PasswordPolicyRuleDto"

nodes.bodyText: Document in the ticket and comment here that the inheritance in Rest API is different
Actually, that's an oversight on my part. It should inherit.
